recipes: The reckoners are out in force tonight! I hear their whistles and their finger-snapping at every corner. But I've made it to the station just ahead of their enforcers.
Let's hope I don't have to resort to violence.
I've begun. [Keep an eye on the Operation. Challenges will arise along the way.]
We have work to do. [Three Progress means success. There'll be challenges before that.]
A creature of crushing strength lairs here. [A total <sprite name=edge> 10 or <sprite name=moth> 10 will defeat it.]
A creature of crushing strength lairs here. I'm more a match for it.
A creature of crushing strength lairs here. I can't face it head-on, so I've turned to trickery.
A creature of crushing strength lairs here. I've prudently retreated.
My accomplice has chosen this moment to ask for a larger share than we'd agreed.
I've disposed of my associate. A pity, but I won't be made a fool of like that.
I've been injured, and forced to retreat.
The Colonel's shrines invariably smell of gunpowder and snow.
I spent the evening there in meditation, and came away with a clearer recollection of certain techniques from my youth.
The Lionsmith's shrines smell of big cats and hot iron.
I spent the morning there in meditation, and came away with a clearer recollection of certain techniques from my youth.
The power honoured here might accept a certain vow. But you would gain nothing from that just yet. [Try this again once you have a Defiance Temptation on the table.]
A consecration to the powers of conflict is irrevocable as a scar or a betrayal. [You cannot be consecrated twice.]
This should trigger only if neither Consecration recipe does.
Make a Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine?
Meditation here could improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach.
Make a Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine
Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach.
My bones creak. My hearing seems sharper.
Make a Pilgrimage to a Brazen Shrine?
Exercise here could improve my understanding of the techniques the Lionsmith's Names teach.
Make a Pilgrimage to a Brazen Shrine
Exercise here could improve my understanding of the techniques the Lionsmith's Names teach.
I could dedicate myself to the Colonel. [This will increase Defiance, and limit my dealings with the Lionsmith.]
I have masked my eyes and scarred my skin. I have bound myself with the Nine Patient Oaths. I am a soldier of the Colonel, who will not release me.
I could dedicate myself to the Lionsmith. [This will increase Defiance, and limit my dealings with the Colonel.]
I have split the beast's blood and scorched my skin. I have undergone the Three Valorous Trials. I am a warrior of the Lionsmith, unless some day he releases me.
I might choose to take the Unflinching Vow, which demands tenacity at no matter what cost. [This will make it impossible to win the game with an Obscurity victory, but will increase your Defiance.]
'Each torment is a lesson. Each scar is a weapon. There is no defeat but annihilation.'

I might choose to take the Brazen Vow, which demands boldness in even the direst circumstances. [This will make it impossible to win the game with an Obscurity victory, but will increase your Defiance.]
'From valour, strength. From strength, valour. There is no defeat but shame.'
I need to move on. [You might end up anywhere.]

My train leaves at dawn. Have I forgotten anything? [This is a destination at the Map's Edge. There's no onward travel. Once you arrive, you'll need to be ready to end this business. You will leave everything behind, including any Allies.]

This is a last resort. I'll be easier to track outside the safety of crowds. I don't know the lie of the land. I might easily die an undignified death. [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
Prepare to Depart for a Remote Destination

My train leaves at dawn. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]

Time to go. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
This is a Remote destination. I'll need sufficient Cash to pay my way.
I'll need Cash to pay my way.

Time to go. Have I forgotten anything? [You can only take Portable Assets with you. Departure will end all ongoing reckoner actions and remove all Traces, but it will also abandon Assets, Locations, Destinations, Local Contacts, and ongoing Operations.]
I may need this. [You can take anything Portable with you, but it'll lengthen your preparations.
This is as far as my allies will go. Time to say goodbye.

Deleting the rkx verb and then recreating it with the alt works fine because effect execution occurs in turn inside each recipe, and alt additional=true
gives us another recipe. But keep an eye on this.
Through the darkness into a new day. I've gone far enough that the reckoners will have to look harder than usual. Unless they're already here?
Always run this after a travel attempt! It converts packed assets back into assets.
Take advantage of opportunities and assets.
A direct assault on my pursuer. [This will destroy all Obscurity.]
Priority>createdefiance, in case someone is actually under attack from a pursuer
None of them could ever stand against me, not alone -
Priority>createdefiance, in case someone is actually under attack from a pursuer
Use an Edge technique to attack my pursuer. [This will destroy all Obscurity.]
Reckoners aren't immortal. We only buy years and sell them. If that ever needed proving, I've proved it tonight.
Reckoners aren't immortal. We only buy years and sell them. If that ever needed proving, I've proved it tonight. [I've disposed of my pursuer. But more will already be on the way.]
They used to say it would take a silver bullet to kill my Foe. I saw that tried, and I saw it fail. But what about this?

No reckoner is ever foolish enough to pass into the higher levels of the Mansus. To draw the attention of the true Long - or their masters - would invite annihilation. But my Foe certainly knew something of the invisible arts. Perhaps I should, too.

No reckoner is ever foolish enough to pass into the higher levels of the Mansus. To draw the attention of the true Long - or their masters - would invite annihilation. But my Foe had some traffic with the Hours of struggle and conquest. He enjoyed certain protections.
My Foe knows something of the 'invisible arts.' Perhaps it's time I applied myself to their study, too.
Use a sacred weapon to attack my Foe
In confronting me, he too's become a target... but not an easy one. [This will destroy all Obscurity.]
Use an Edge technique to attack my Foe
In confronting me, he too has become a target... but not an easy one. [This will destroy all Obscurity.]

My Foe's body is pierced with seven wounds, as a city wall might be pierced with seven gates: and every wound has ceased to bleed. His heart lies trembling in my bloodied hand. He's dead. It's over. My own wounds will strengthen to scars. And now my pursuers will fall to squabbling over his territory, and leave me alone here... all alone.
This might be effective against my Foe's protections. I might even be able to duel him. If he were alone. And if I had some reason to believe I could actually defeat him in single combat.
This would be useless against my Foe's protections, but I may, regrettably, have to shoot someone else at some point.
I've learnt something of the protections that my Foe uses. I might even be able to duel him. If he were alone. And if I had some reason to believe I could actually defeat him in single combat.
My treatments may not be quite what they seem... but my results are always excellent. [A reasonably safe way to convert stolen lifespan into cash.]
Business hours. [Add a Stolen Year to convert it to cash.]
I've made a little money. It's almost like honest work.
My patients have paid generously. They'll live long. I've guaranteed it.

The sun crosses the sky. Night pursues it. [At the end of each cycle you'll lose a Trace if you have one, or gain Obscurity if you don't. Every cycle there is a chance that reckoners will arrive - but never in this first cycle.]
No enemies arrive in the first turn.

The sun crosses the sky. Night pursues it. [At the end of each cycle you'll lose a Trace if you have one, or gain Obscurity if you don't. Reckoners may also enter the city. This is much more likely if you've created Traces.]
[When this completes, it'll eat a Trace, if you have any; or give you an Obscurity card, if you have no Traces.]
The sky is going. Then everything else will. [If you still have seven Wounds when this completes, you'll die.]
If Truth is Time's daughter, whose child is Forgetfulness? [You have gained Obscurity.]
You don't get obscurity if you have extant traces, but also you don't get obscurity if the Foe has arrived
It's hard to pass through the world and leave no footprints. [Reckoners can use Traces to find you.]
